Description:
Job Title: Financial Analyst - Multi-Group Physician Practice
Location: Remote(This opportunity is a remote position however, to ensure effective collaboration and coordination with our team, the role requires availability during Eastern Time Zone business hours).
Company Overview:
Personic Health is a leading advanced mobile wound care multi-group physician practice dedicated to delivering high-quality healthcare services to our communities. With a commitment to excellence and innovation, we strive to provide comprehensive care while continuously improving patient outcomes.
Position Overview:We are seeking a dynamic and experienced Financial Analyst to join our team. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in financial management within a multi-group physician practice setting. They will be responsible for overseeing financial operations, reporting, budgeting, strategic planning, and accounting duties to support our organization's growth and success.
Key Responsibilities:Help streamline and drive financial reporting processes, including the preparation of financial statements, P&L analysis, and variance reporting.Oversee inventory management and control procedures to optimize efficiency and minimize costs.Develop and maintain robust business and financial models to support decision-making and strategic planning initiatives.Lead the development of comprehensive financial plans and forecasts to guide organizational growth and expansion.Ensure compliance with taxation requirements and regulations, including oversight of tax planning and reporting activities.Proficiency with accounting software such as QuickBooks and Sage, ensuring accurate and timely financial data management.Prior experience with Sage requiredAssist with accounts payable and accounts receivable processes, including reconciling accounts and ensuring timely payments and collections.Implement internal controls and procedures to safeguard financial assets and ensure compliance with regulatory requirements.Oversee payroll processes, ensuring accurate compensation for healthcare staff.Track and analyze expenses to support budgeting and cost analysis initiatives.Support with revenue cycle management, including billing, collections, and reimbursement processes.Stay informed about changes and updates in accounting standards and regulations relevant to healthcare finance.Collaborate with other departments, such as HR and operations, to ensure accurate financial data and reporting.Implement cost accounting methodologies to analyze and allocate expenses across departments or service lines.Identify opportunities for process improvement and efficiency in accounting operations.Support with financial audits and facilitate the audit process.Maintain fixed assets and depreciation schedules within the organization.Lead financial forecasting and budgeting processes, including variance analysis and budget performance tracking.Ensure compliance with regulatory requirements related to healthcare accounting, such as HIPAA and Medicare billing guidelines.Foster a culture of excellence and high performance within the finance team.
Qualifications:Master’s degree in finance, Accounting, or related field; MBA or CPA preferred.Proven experience in financial analysis within a multi-group physician practice setting, with 5-7 years of relevant experience.Strong understanding of financial reporting, analysis, budgeting, and accounting principles.Extensive knowledge of taxation aspects related to entities within the healthcare industry.Technical proficiency with accounting software (QuickBooks, Sage) and Microsoft Excel.Ability to thrive in a fast-paced, growth-oriented environment.Strong work ethic, high energy, and a commitment to excellence.Sage experience is required
Join our team and make a difference! If you meet the qualifications outlined above and are passionate about financial analysis within the healthcare industry, we encourage you to apply. Please submit your resume and cover letter detailing your relevant experience and why you are the ideal candidate for this position. We look forward to hearing from you.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
